content: Great app, been using it since it came out. Has all the FFG Star Wars games: Star Wars RPG, Legion, X-wing, Armada, Imperial Assault, & Rebellion. d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d%. You can change up the sounds or put it on silent. You can shake your device to roll or hit a button.

I would like this better if the amount of time the dice roll across the screen was longer, configurable, and/or random between the dice themselves. For example, all the dice roll exactly the same (about 1 second) and all come to rest at exactly the same time. It's about as satisfying as watching a random function spit out a number. It just doesn't feel as real. With just a little bit of tuning, I think this dice would make the dice roll feel more real.
The loss of standard dice was a really big let down. Used to be 5 stars.
Pretty good ðŸ˜Š
Excellent app but the Force rating die results show the opposite alignment values
Always my first choice

This app replaces the need to buy $15 dice from the store for fantasy flight star wars games. But I wish it was updated with more wallpapers. Legion and xwing have saga content like the prequels and no where in here is a prequel based wallpaper
This app blocks too many standard phone features when running. I use to have a version for Android 6.0 which also had regular dice. They seem to have ripped that out of the current app.
Cool App! Love the customization.
Works well, but on certain dice rolls the totals go off screen with no way to a scroll over to it.
After the new version is good with dice returned and new additions of other games. Though with the force dice results they look to contradict with what is rolled.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice and hope that you'll send us your suggestions at softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com. Please note that we've added all generic polyhedral RPG dice back to the app in v2.0.2.

content: Great for Star Wars: Armada

I love the app, but the recent changes stink. You used to be able to change the sound options between Rebels and Empire but no longer can. Users could also use this app for any gaming system, but now can only use it for Star Wars. No more using it for d20 or d10 game systems. Hey developers, we paid for the app, shouldn't we as the consumers decide how to use the app?
Does the job. It is not as good and animated as the videos I saw a while back. I guess it was the previous version that seems to get better review here.

great app except they updated and removed the standard dice set. Additionally the user interface is more clunky and complicated to use and there's quite a bit of lag and delay when trying to select options. I'm disappointed that I paid for this and then they changed the functionality of the app.
The UI has changed and now has LESS functionality. Also, why is there absolutely no love for the prequel trilogy!?
Camt quit app.
love this app. very useful in game play
It was 5 stars, but one update took away the standard fantasy gaming dice option.

Props for adding generic dice back in, useful for times you forget your own or simply don't have any on hand. Old design still looked immensely better and was much more user friendly imho but overall a good app.
replyContent: Please note that we've updated the app to v2.0.2 which adds all of the generic polyhedral dice back to the RPG pool. D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, and D20.

content: good app, like the recent updates. please fix the display of force pips, they're currently showing inverted.
great help for tabletop playing. maybe an option to select the dice and then roll though? otherwise as you are adding dice individually there could be an opportunity to want to cheat.
I really liked the old app, this one kinda sucks to be honest. the interface just feels clunky and isn't as animated as before.

I used this as my dice rolling app. unfortunately they removed the full polyhedral dice set so now it's unusable. you used to be able to pick any available die for either star wars or generic poly set. will ha e to uninstall and find another app.
It would be useful if you could link your players in the game to show their rolls on the GM's screen, and vice-versa somehow.
After the update that added Legion and RPG dice this app is more than worth the money, especially since my crew plays at least three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games regularly, thanks!
Yup presets now gone and unusable.

Used to be better... They changed the layout and a bit of the functionality. The old app worked better and had a more intuitive flow. Still works, but the really took a step or few backward when they "updated" it.
Honestly, the older version was amazing. I don't understand why they changed this so much, but the ui has become a clunky mess. If I could I wish to reinstall the older version.
4 stars as it is now, 5 stars if it performed the auto calculations. The older app did. It's still a useful tool though, and I liked the way I can create templates for rolls.
Great app all around.

What the hell! What happened to my dice app? The old version was loaded with awesome sound effects, neat loading screens, and just a generally exciting and cool Star Wars feel to it. I always looked forward to using it for my X-Wing games. Why would they get rid of all those features?? Just for some slightly higher-definition dice?? I want the app that I paid for. This cheap replacement is bland and boring!
replyContent: We appreciate your feedback!  We're dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice and hope that you'll send us your suggestions at: softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com

content: Best dice app for playing Star Wars rpg

Why doesn't the "preset dice" button do anything? Why do the dice come out with outcomes before you roll them? Why does the help menu not match the current UI? I'm really disappointed that FFG thought I would just love anything Star Wars they made...

Nearly perfect before the update, but now has some pretty big flaws. Colours seem overexposed now, making the blue dice look who's for example, sound settings are no longer modular (not are there choices for it) and results of rolls are listed very counter intuitively with advantages/threats before success/failure. New wallpapers are nice, but do not really make up for loss of user-friendliness, thus no longer five stars.
I hate this version, and i can't seem to find how to quit the app on my A8
They changed the UI and now it looks like trash I can't believe I paid for this
In general it does what it says on the tin, the fact that you no longer have a proper exit button is annoying. Thw same goes for the Genesys dice roller app.
Use to enjoy using this app for normal dice rolling as well. Disappointed that's been removed ðŸ˜“ðŸ˜“ðŸ˜“
This app used to be amazing. Now I can't use it for D&D. BRING BACK THE STANDARD DICE SET OR WE RIOT.
The old version was better. It lost all of my preset die combinations and there doesn't seem to be a way to make them again. And you can't chance sound effects anymore?
Hate the new interface.

Older version was better. They did bring back the d4, d8, d12, d20 dice(thanks!). It still takes almost twice as long to launch. New menu isn't as useful. Presets are a little awkward to use & only allow 8 characters max for naming. The biggest improvement was the new wallpapers.
Editted review: Polyhedral dice now back in, yay, one of the cleanest dice apps around, regardless of what you want to use it for.
replyContent: Please note that we've updated the app to v2.0.2 which adds all of the generic polyhedral dice back to the RPG pool. D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, and D20.

content: Generic polyhedral dice are back! This means I can use this app to run all my drive games, not just Star Wars only (though that's nice, too)
replyContent: Please note that we've updated the app to v2.0.2 which adds all of the generic polyhedral dice back to the RPG pool. D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, and D20.

content: They have fixed the only issue I compared to complain about and it is a wonderful nice app that works very well
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice and hope that you'll send us your suggestions at softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com. Please note that we've added all generic polyhedral RPG dice back to the app in v2.0.2.

content: 5 stars now that the generic polyhedral dice are back!
replyContent: Please note that we've updated the app to v2.0.2 which adds all of the generic polyhedral dice back to the RPG pool. D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, and D20.

content: Got all dice now
Much better interface than before. Now has Legion dice!
replyContent: Legion dice are now available in v2.0!

content: New update is ugly, clunky, and not what i paid for. My presets are gone and i cant use this app for what i got it for. Bad redesign, put it back.
replyContent: We appreciate your feedback! Please note that presets are still available in v.2.0 and that we're dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice. We hope that you'll send us your suggestions at: softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com

content: Please, add possibility to colour standard dices

New smooth interface, new backgrounds, dice for all of the star wars tabletop games and even general polyhedrals for those who use this for other game systems as well. Incredible way to save money on dice and have a blast at the table.
I don't like this version. I like the old one better, so I will remove this app from my device. This one is to clunky to use. I will use a totaly different dice App.
replyContent: We appreciate your feedback!  We're dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice and hope that you'll send us your suggestions at: softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com

content: Love the updated interface, much easier to navigate and understand. I miss being able to customize different sound themes though.

REVISED: Ok, you can still get std rpg dice by opening the die tray at lower-right and selecting them. My bad. This is an awesome app. Back up to 5 stars. I just erased my years-standing 5-star review to revise this to 4 stars for this reason only: One of the best things about the app was the generic rpg die rolling function, usable with almost any traditional tabletop rpg. This really aggravates me, because it was superior to any of the other die rolling apps out there. Now I have to choose between several of the least-poorly implemented apps available when for years I'd already had the best.
I am wondering why you would choose to remove functionality in your app. Removing the numeric dice removes half the reason I bought the app in the first place.
Update fixed non standard dice being missing thanks for bringing them back.
The first update did not have the standard dice...this one does! I've had this app on iOS and Android. It is a great application, does what you need and is fun to have for all my tabletop games.

....Still works after update and rolls dice well. My presets are gone and work way different now. The app loads much slower compared to older version. You can't use the back button. You'd think they would add something useful for an update like color your success/failure result differently so you can easily visualize outcome of roll.

As much as I like it, and using it for Edge of the Empire i have adapted it for a new game using the same dice roll. The only problem is that it is capped at 20 dice and I need much more then that. Is there a way you could fix that please? <3
Probably the best virtual dice app I've used.
I like the new interface in the latest update and am glad that FFG added back in the standard dice. The only real issue is there is no good way to exit the app without having to kill it.
I have been using the app for a few years, and I like the new GUI. However, I also miss some of the customization of the older version, so it's not quite a full 5 stars for me.
It's OK now, but it was awesome before the latest update. At least they added all the dice back.

I liked the previous version, but the update ruined the use ability. No way to exit, dice removed etc. Very disappointed. ****Changed to 4 stars as die have returned - still won't close without ending app ****

I like the new and improved Interface. The dice and new wallpapers look great! There is only one reason I'm not giving it 5 stars. The previous interface had a neat preset feature. That I wish they would bring back.

UPDATE (8/23/18): FFG has reinstated the standard numerical polyhedrals! Bumping back up to five stars!  -- Well, this is unfortunate. I had been using this app as my all-purpose electronic dice roller, but the newest update has removed all but the dice specifically used by Fantasy Flight Games' Star Wars products. It works great for that, but the removal of a feature means I'll be removing a star, as well.
The older app you could exit right from the app. Now you have to use the button to kill running apps. How hard is it to put a exit in the app itself.
App does what it says on the tin, rolls dice. A lot less chance of them ending up on the floor from a bad roll, though. ðŸ¤£
I thoroughly enjoyed it until the new update.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice and hope that you'll send us your suggestions at softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com

content: Brill. Yay legion dice!

Was 5 stars...then this latest update ruined it. Animations for rolls are choppy and delayed, it deleted ALL of my presets for my games, and the interface is terrible. I wish you would roll this update back. Ugh.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We are dedicated to supporting and improving Star Wars Dice and hope that you'll send us your suggestions at softwaresupport@fantasyflightgames.com

content: Bring back numeric dice, please

Used to have a higher rating but now they took away the option for standard dice. As a player and GM who plays multiple systems, and sometimes isn't sure until he shows up which game he's playing I liked having the variety and it's why I was ok paying for the app. Please bring back standard dice

Great app, but I wish they would have left the standard numeric dice. As a GM, it is great having all of the FFG game dice I need, but it was also convenient having the standard dice available. I was always going to this app, but now it will be limited to only those sessions fir FFG Star Wars.
Needs Star Wars Legion dice added please.
Needs Legion!!!
Where is the Legion dice? was promised to update in may
replyContent: Legion dice are now available in v2.0!

content: Missing Star Wars Legion which is most likely to exceed the dice needed.
replyContent: Legion dice are now available in v2.0!

content: Great app. Does what it says on the box.

I like it but the feature for saving dice and settings for the RPG does not 
work at all. If you turn off the program you loose everything.

Very nice app, but disappointed that they don't support all of their games 
on this. You need to add dice for Legion!
PLEASE add Legion!
Decent enough but it's a bit absurd that Legion dice aren't available.
Great app, waiting on Legion to be supported though.
Add Legion dice, please!
The App works great but it needs to incorporate the dice from the REBELLION expansion Rise of the Empire
Needs to be updated for Rise of the Empire expansion for Rebellion.

Statistics on pools of d6 are badly skewed towards >3.  The rest of the app just really nicely done but since it's propose is to replace dice, thus random number generation, it fails at that.  Send code, happy to help fix it. :)
Does what it does well, smoothly and simply
Awesome app I have been finding my self getting offers to play and not have my dice on me so now I always have them.
I find this app useful. Just wish my group wouldn't tease me for not always using real dice. ðŸ˜Š

Well if you use the 6 sided normal dice from the app the results will almost always be 4's or higher like 5/6 of the times when i roll. Gives an inaccurate result and i am then also distrustful in its algorithms for all its other results.

At first I was dubious considering the price and I already have dice.. However this is good. Very easy to add or remove dice,, what appears to be unlimited presets, and a few sound/background options, and it turns out it's worth it if you don't want actual dice. Please support split screen
Does exactly what it is meant to do and has the added bonus of doing it well.
would be better with the imperial result shown on the upper side, with distinct color for each side red and green on X wing min
Most utilitarian app for five rolling, and not just for star wars dice!
Still prefer real dice but these come in super handy when the dice guy forgets his dice.

This app is much cheaper than buying physical dice for EotE (especially since you'll probably want at least two sets) and it can cancel out symbols so you can quickly see your results. This really speeds things up in play!
The dice rolling itself is great, but it needs a way to add fixed results (eg, curved hilt adding 1 advantage after roll) to the total.

As it pertains to X Wing, this app would be better if there were laser blaster sounds for when the red attack dice are rolled and engine sounds for the green dice being rolled. Each faction would have their own distinct sounds e.g. Empire has Tie fighter engine sounds with the rattle snake-like laser sounds.

The roller works great, friendly and colorful. I wish the dice settings would stay when you close though. I always have to add my preset dice pool in again, and have to check the "cancel results". Please update the app do I don't need to adjust settings each time
This is one of the best dive apps i have use. Can be used for almost any game that needs dice.
Its dice for starwars games
Cheaper and much easier than using the dice.

As of the most recent update, this is now incompatible with my Galaxy Tab 10.1 and now fails to initialize entirely as another reviewer has mentioned. Support should be ongoing for devices and to see this fail so early on is highly disappointing. I hope this is rectified soon.
This is a great app, really well thought out and has dice to more than just one game. I use it for Edge of the Empire and X-wing
As good as you can expect.
No worth 5 bucks imo
It can be especially useful when working out overall results in, for example, Imperial Assault. Not quite as satisfying as rolling the real thing, but that's always going to be the case.
Really helps calculate those dice pools quickly in game.
Useful for when I don't want to reach across the table playing Imperial Assault. Hope they update to add Rebellion dice soon!
Where is Rebellion? Can't be that hard to add.
Need to add Star Wars Rebellion.

It also has supporting typical RPG di. Less expensive than purchasing a full set of SW di and all the others. and if your a parent of a toddler, no choking hazards/ opportunity to step on them in the middle of the night cos he was using said di to create a special garden.

Cheaper than dice and great for pre-assembling dice pools. I use it more for the rpgs... not sure if people prefer real dice for the other games. Looks great but can sound annoying at times. Overall good.
Any chance of a landscape mode?
I love dice. This sucker rolls em for me. What else could you ask for?
Little on the pricey side for what it is. Much cheaper than going and buying extra dice, however. Recommend using this app on something easy to shake, like a phone.

The general utility is high... but what it doesn't do is important, especially when GMing or playing non-FFG games. It doesn't allow changing colors of standard dice, so you cannot roll multiple sets easily. It doesn't have d100 pairing, so you can't  readily roll multiple crits (such as from autofire) at once. So, i'll generally stick to real dice.
This is hands down the best dice roller I have tried. Well worth the $5.

Great app to use for the RPG in particular given that there are some scenarios where the dice pool can get rather large! Took a bit of fiddling to figure out the interface so a short tutorial might be helpful but overall wasn't too hard to get it.
Good app, but lack of landscape mode kills it for me.

I just played the rpg for the first time last night. As a novice it took some time to calculate the results of a die roll. The cancel out feature of this app removes the need to do the calculation manually, and will surely speed up gameplay. I recommend this for anyone willing to use digital die.
Needs an sound volume slider and would totally get a 5 from me if you could sync a bunch of Star Wars dice roller apps together for a group game.
Tight design and good implementation. Takes some getting used to for operation, but nothing overly complicated and extremely usable.
One of the best dice apps and it covers standard polyhedrals as well. It's also cheaper than a set of dice. Then it is all topped off in the SW theme. What's not to love?

Love this app! Looks great, animations are fast and fluid, and it's useful for more than just Star Wars games. My minor quibble is that the interstitial animations can't be disabled, so it takes an extra second to navigate around the app. If the animations could be disabled or toned down as an option, that would definitely earn this great app a 5.
Well designed app. Does it's job well.

If you haven't got the money or space for all those expensive dice for the RPGs: Age of Rebellion, Edge of the Empire and Force and Destiny (They all use same dice) including the D10s, I mean literally every dice you need. Then this is your app. Well worth the price it even presents the result of the dice roll if you can't be bothered counting the symbols yourself. Even if you have the dice, buy it anyway as a standby. That way you'll never go to a game empty handed. ðŸ˜€

Considering how much it costs to purchase dice and the hassle of preparing them, this app is worth it, you get access to any dice you need for fantasy flight games and for your standard 4,6,8,10,12,20, and percentile dice. Works great on my tablet, worth $4.99.
This app is great, even for as a generic roller for other games.

Its one rippin' roller. Ill never need real dice again as long as the gm allows rollers, I have had one that doesn't, he's paranoid about them being fixed too easily, like real dice can't be loaded either. I had some early confusion with the success portion of the triumph die, but I discovered it was indicated and cancelled properly... my bad :D
Love me some SWXM

FFG never ship enough dice with their  games so it's handy to have this app on standby. It's a little expensive but the interface and graphics are better than most. I'd still have liked a little more functionality thrown in, like some rules reference stuff, or lists of options for interpreting the various Advantage and Threat dice you've just rolled.
This is one of the better dice rollers that I've seen out there. Cool backgrouds, sounds, and a tool that orients the dice for you makes this a winner.
It's got everything I want in a dice roller app and I't much better than dice apps I've tried in the past.  I like that it also comes with some standard dice so you can use it for other games.
Great app for the occasions more dice are needed. App definitely needs a proper scum emblem background though. Would have been five stars with that.

Only thing missing is the ability to add static bonus to a roll (ie: always add one advantage to this rolls result). Other than that the app is great but that one simple thing has kept me from using it consistantly.

If I'm missing something let me know, but on my phone the only way to delete dice is to select each die you want to remove, then long-press the screen and try to find the "delete dice" option under my finger on the pop-up pinwheel menu. It'd be way easier to just select the dice and have plus/minus buttons appear on the screen automatically, or the modify options for those dice. Seems very clunky and counterintuitive right now.
4.99 may sound steep, but this is the best dice app I've come across. Good rolling, not processor heavy, and all types of dice (even numbered dice} make this a solid all around purchase.
Smooth app, makes rolling easy. Wish there was faster why to select dice on a fly since the rolls change so often. Maybe two rows to select dice so all of the dice for a game are accessible.
Works for all franchises. Just ask your opponent first!
Got update, includes new dice for imp assault and armada
Covers all of fantasy flight Star War games.

With it working for Star Wars RPG, X-Wing, and regular RPGs, it's well worth the price over the $15 the physical dice cost, plus, it's a great use in pick-up games.  The sound effects do get annoying, but turn them off.  I hope FFG puts out more Star Wars RPG apps.  Plus, cancelling successes and the d100 working correctly, it's a killer app!
Please add support for imperial assault. i have other ffg starwars games and IA support would be groovy, maybe add campaign  tracking?
Make playing on the road an easy day.
This is a great option when my dice go cold. Sometimes the app goes cold too. Need to up my sacrifices to the dice gods. Will imperial assault be added in an upcoming update?
I love the app and it's features but I feel like digital dice rollers still don't perfectly capture how real dice function.
Love it.  Great for all my games.
It's really easy to use,  and helps out when you're in a hurry.

Nice piece of software, very well crafted. Also a very handy RPG tool. The UI is not as intuitive as it could be, though. I would also allow for rolling a die via the drag-and-drop gesture, and for selecting one and rolling it by picking it from the top "toolbox" and dragging it to the "board".
5$, doesn't deduce the dice roll into words...? wtf........
Awesome sauce with a double side of extra crispy bacon

First impression is that Star Wars dice is great. I agree with others that it would be nice to have the symbol titles for the Fantasy Flight Star Wars specific dice in the help section for new players like myself. I especially like the versatility of having all standard RPG dice available.  The ability to put in six sided dice mean I could use this app for everything from the original d6 Star Wars RPG to Yahtzee type games.

As much as I love dice, this app is much easier to use and it is actually faster at generating the pool that I need. If you play edge of the empire and are considering another set of dice, I'd strongly recommend this app. I haven't touched the real set of dice I have since I got this app.
This is the cheapest and easiest way to obtain dice for the new RPG and minis games. It does everything that it needs to.

Excellent companion to the new Star Wars Edge of the Empire RPG!  Will this app need updates for the upcoming Age of Rebellion and Force and Destiny Core Rulebooks?  Now, get to work FFG and come up with a Character Generator and GM's Toolkit app.
A little more than I would like to spend,  but worth it.
Great addition to the game, almost a necessity. But over priced. Taking advantage of the players.

At first I used this dice app for the EotE rpg. It was great, I love that it calculates your dice roll for you. You can even use standard dice. I soon became addicted and started using the app in everyday life.  Should I ask this girl out. 2 success with 4 threat. She said yes but she was a he. Should I ask for a raise. 3 fail 1 despair 2 advantage.  I was fired for using the app while talking with customers. The customer bought me a beer.  This app changed my life,  I think? Let me roll and see. 3 triumphs

This is actually a great dice app! It is pricey, but it comes with features that surprised me. Considering the price of physical dice (standard, EotE, X-Wing), this app is well worth it. When it was first released, it was even more worth it since FFG had not yet released the EotE dice to play their game... Overall, I would recommend this app even if you don't play Edge of the Empire or X-Wing, since it includes all kinds of dice. Just think of it as a dice app with a Star Wars theme. Pew, pew sounds included!

Substantially better now that it can calculate the net total for SW RPG dice.  There is still one problem: I find it difficult to remember what the symbols are supposed to mean. It would be nice with an option to have the meaning of each symbol written under the number when the results are summed up.
This App works so well with our Edge of the Empire game and also Age of Rebellion. I can't wait to use it in other games too!  No complaints at all.
Very fun and useful app for the X-Wing game. Worth the $$$ IMO.
Even if you don't play Star Wars EotE, the standard RPG dice and the brilliant UI make this a great purchase for any roleplayer.
It doesn't react to my stylus for my Samsung Galaxy Note 2.  I have to use my fingers to press buttons.  Otherwise good.
Performs as advertised, but the sound effects get annoying quick.

I am starting the rpg with my boys and decided to get this app to check out the dice. I think it works great. Would be nice to have recorded rolls to go back and refer to but seems fine as it is. I think more polish on the interface as the game is developed would be a nice touch.
Well worth the money. Works perfectly!
Some of the best 3d dice out there and smooth shake mechanics. Very little rendering lag. Could use more configurable math mechanics.
It's a but expensive, but the app is very well done! Makes the game better with sound.
Noisy, animated, slow and distracting. All the subtlety of a 1998 flash animation.
Exellent app...very easy to use and understand!!!
With the newest update that totals the result for you, this app is now perfect.  It also works well as a dice roller for normal dice.
Love the app.  Emailed about the d100 issue and got an actual reply.  Now I that d100's work properly.  Nice work  Add an option to change the color of the general dice you get 5 stars.

This dice roller is both a space saver and time saver! Not to mention having to worry about lost dice from a terrible miss toss ! Fumble chart! lol It is so customizable...Great job in creating this app! Much thanks!
This app has everything you would expect and does it perfectly.
No longer works with the nexus 10. All dice appear as... Shadow dice? (For lack of a better term). It's impossible to see the colors and results on their top surfaces following a roll.

Very simply, this app is visually pleasing and functional. My only real complaint is that it does not automatically tally and cancel the dice results. It only shows the count of each symbol. So for instance, it will show 3 successes, 2 failures, 2 advantages, and 2 threats instead of boiling it down to 1 net success. Other than that, it works fine. And it makes droid and blaster sounds when you roll, to spice up your gaming session.
This will be very usefull for everyone in my group!
Easy to use. Works as intended.

Great app with simple and easy design, great features and sounds.  Is it possible to give the General dice selection a colour picker so it can have 2 6d rolling together but representing different stats?
I use this for D n D, Star Fleet Battles Call to arms and any other games using dice. Well worth the money, it has very cool back grounds and sounds for fun.
Not a bad aod at all. Works great save fpr percentile dice which it just adds them together, so 00 and 0 onle equal 10 not 100 like they should. But so far thats all I could find wrong.

This app seemed overpriced at first, but after buying X-Wing, I found this app useful.  After the last big update, it has actally been very fun to play with as well.  So many neat sound clips, and the functionality is awesome.  Took the time to program in every combination of "shots" and now playing is a breeze even with new players.  Definitely recommend this app!

Best dice roller I've seen. Simple and easy to use. My only (minor) compaints are the sounds get annoying fast (but can be turned off), and I wish the results had the symbols labeled (I keep forgeting what they are).
It would be great if it were able to just give the results of the roll. Like "success with a single triumph"
Must have app for any fans of the star wars rpg. Simple and elegant dice roller with all the options you need. Sounds and visuals are great. Very customizable.
One of the most, if not the most clear die rollers. If it would suspend screen blackouts, it would be even better.
The only problem I've come across is that rolling D6s always roll a 1 when you add them to the table unless they bounce off another die. The random number seed needs fixing I suspect.

Awesome app! I don't normally like dice apps for gaming, but for some reason this one really feels intuitive. Would like to see a custom background feature, but...that certainly doesn't take anything away from the app.
Since update, awesome!
Recent update make this the PERFECT dice app! Thank you, FFG! App tallies results, re roll faces, custom presets,  easy interface. Great app!

For the dice rolling be able to swipe to throw away dice. I know it would mess up rolling but it will help and when rolling new dice make it so IG asks you re roll or show last result for the DM. It will help.
Only bad point for me is that there's no quick way to delete dice.  Being able to flick them off the screen would be great.
amazing what ffg has done with sw!! follows in the spirit of WEG! this is awesome!  and this app has excellent clear permissions!

As with all things that FFG produce it is beautiful to look at.  It is essential to purchase this app to play the Beta of starwars as the dice cannot be purchased yet.  It does have a set of generic dice and up to 20 can be rolled at one time. If FFG updated the app to allow me to change the colour any one of generic dice then I would change my rating to 5*, as this would allow to me have the ability to put a wild dice in any one roll. Apart from that one little grumble it is easy to use.
One of the best 3D die rolling programs I've seen on here. Essential for the EotE and X-Wing games, but also useful for any other RPG out there.

After a good amount of back and forth with the designer, it looks like we fixed the issues it was having. Very helpful designer, great communication. This is a VERY NICE app. Price might be a bit high, as some have said, but it's a SW dice roller for X-WING and EDGE OF EMPIRE and a standard poly set dice roller too. So over all, pretty decent deal.
This goes perfect with the RPG!  especially since the dice aren't available yet without the sticker sheet.
Works great on both my Droid 4 and my rooted Nook Tablet.

This app looks great.  It is a bit pricey, though at $4.99.  I am looking forward to using it for the role-playing game, Edge of the Empire BETA, and the X-Wing miniature game. On a downside, it freezes my smartphone when I use it, or change dice apps (from the role-playing game to the X-Wing game).
I'm really impressed with app. It is not only usable as a dice roller for FFG's two new Star Wars offerings, but it will work great for most of my other RPG dice needs as well. Well worth the money.

Wasn't sure about paying $5 for what looked like a simple app, but this app is super nice. Great graphics, sounds.. The Force is with the designers. Well worth the price for the quality. Now I can't wait to play the games it goes with!

Very nifty little app that simulates "regular" dice (D20, D12, D10,..ect), Star Wars Minatures Dice, and the new dice for the Star Wars Edge of the Empire beta test. A little steep in price for what it does. Looks pretty and has some fun basic Star Wars sound effects (Droids, Lightsabers, and Darth Vader's breathing). I would note that the "shaking of the device" function to roll the dice does not work on the Motorola Zoom tablet.  All in all a neat little dice roller, looks pretty,and functions (mostly) smoothly.
